description:
Seeking reprieve from a painfully ordinary 9-to-5 existence, mild-mannered office worker Johnson visits the TM corporation, a company that sells virtual dreams. In Johnson's dream adventure, he's the notorious space pirate Cobra! Accompanied by his android partner Lady Armaroid, Cobra fights the lowlife scum of the Pirate Guild by day and saves sultry sirens of space by night.

After the journey is over, events unfold that bring reality into focus. His experience wasn't a dream at all - it was a reawakening of his buried past! With the most feared weapon in the universe, the Psycho Gun, Cobra sets out into the galaxy in pursuit of love, fortune and fame.

(Source: Discotek)

name.native: アーマロイド・レディ

node.description:
[Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ludwig_van_Beethoven)

Ludwig van Beethoven was a German composer and pianist.

Beethoven remains one of the most admired composers in the history of Western music; his works rank amongst the most performed of the classical music repertoire. His works span the transition from the classical period to the romantic era in classical music. His career has conventionally been divided into early, middle, and late periods. The "early" period, during which he forged his craft, is typically considered to have lasted until 1802. From 1802 to around 1812, his "middle" period showed an individual development from the "classical" styles of Joseph Haydn and Wolfgang Amadeus Mozart, and is sometimes characterized as "heroic." During this time, he began to suffer increasingly from deafness. In his "late" period from 1812 to his death in 1827, he extended his innovations in musical form and expression.

(Source: Wikipedia)

[Website](https://www.maocloud.net/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/MaoCloud) |  [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/maomaowsan/) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/user/MaoCloud)

Multi-talented freelance artist who specialized in depicting nature, such as clouds and waves.

After graduating from high school, he joined [Toei Animation](https://anilist.co/studio/18/), and worked under [Keiichirou Kimura](https://anilist.co/staff/168326/). Later joined Madhouse and was one of the studio's leading animators during its early days together with [Akio Sugino](https://anilist.co/staff/103064/) and [Yoshiaki Kawajiri](https://anilist.co/staff/100812/).

[Website](http://www.buichi.com/)

Buichi Terasawa, was a Japanese mangaka pioneer of computer graphic arts. He was the first to introduce computer graphics manga ("TAKERU") in Japan. 

Terasawa was diagnosed with a malignant brain tumor in 1998, and despite surgery and chemotherapy, he relapsed and after surgery was left paralysed on the left side of his body. Terasawa died on September 8, 2023, due to a myocardial infarction.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/杉野昭夫) | [Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Akio_Sugino)

A veteran animator with a career spanning over 50 years.

Noted for his work on shows like [Ashita no Joe](https://anilist.co/anime/2402/), [Ace wo Nerae!](https://anilist.co/anime/311/), [Nobody's Boy: Remi](https://anilist.co/anime/2828/) and [Treasure Island](https://anilist.co/anime/2618/).

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/大塚伸治)

The epitome of the versatile animator capable of adapting to any anime to do outstanding work in that style. Ootsuka's animation is professional but always full of personality and a special verve. 

He is one of the pillars of [Studio Ghibli](https://anilist.co/studio/21/)'s animation. Not confined to the Ghibli style, he has always searched for new means of expression, having done everything from the photorealistic to the cartoonish. The wonderful feeling of weight in the movement of Toshio running around the train station in [Only Yesterday](https://anilist.co/anime/1029/), the delightful bodyguards in [The Cat Returns](https://anilist.co/anime/597/), the little robot coming out of the water in the final episode of [FLCL](https://anilist.co/anime/227/) - all of these are quintessential Ootsuka. 

None other than the animation director of [Tokyo Godfathers](https://anilist.co/anime/759/) has conceded that the film was originally conceived as a project to showcase Ootsuka's talents, in the same way [Genma Taisen](https://anilist.co/anime/1626/) was a vehicle for [Yoshinori Kanada](https://anilist.co/staff/106398/). Most of Ootsuka's scenes in the film were drawn entirely by himself, with no in-betweens, and his cuts which were the first finished, had a determining influence on the direction of the animation by the rest of the animators. 

(Source: [Pelleas](http://www.pelleas.net/animators/#20))

A veteran in his field, having worked as a sound director for over 40 years from late '60s onwards. Predominantly known for his involvement in the [Lupin III](https://anilist.co/anime/1412/) franchise, in which he acted as a sound director for all the series' entries from the [second TV series](https://anilist.co/anime/1425/) onwards up until his retirement from the industry.

More recently he has been working as a lecturer at Eizou Technical Academy.
Katsushi Murakami is a Japanese producer and toy designer formerly employed by Bandai. He has designed for various tokustatsu shows such as Kamen Rider, Super Sentai, and Metal Heroes.
Keishi Yamazaki is a producer and screenwriter.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E7%BE%BD%E7%94%B0%E5%81%A5%E5%A4%AA%E9%83%8E) | [Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kentar%C5%8D_Haneda)

Kentarou Haneda was a Japanese pianist, composer and arranger of popular anime and movies and video game music.

After graduating from the Toho Gakuen School of Music, he taught as a professor at the Tokyo College of Music. He was best known as composer of Wizardry music which was ported to NES and SNES console by Ascii at early 1990, The [Super Dimension Fortress Macross](https://anilist.co/anime/1088/) series, [Barefoot Gen](https://anilist.co/anime/1824/), Ys Symphony, Symphony Sorcerian and Genso Suikoden Ongaku-shu.

Haneda passed away from liver cancer on June 2, 2007.

(Source: Wikipedia)
He was a screenwriter for anime and tokusatsu shows. He had written scripts for the Anime series "Kinniku Man" and its subsequent movies.

An art director who worked for Kobayashi Productions, but left together with [Hiromasa Ogura](https://anilist.co/staff/105312/) and Hiroshi Oono to establish Studio Fuga in March 3, 1983. He stayed until 1997, when he left to establish Moonflower, where he also acts as representative director.
